review: If a doctor neither prepared the tooth, nor takes any measurements for crown, better ask her what is she upto. reply_text: This is for your kind information that a crown cannot be placed if it is not prepared for that type of crown what has been selected. Every adult patient will be informed prior to take a decision regarding the type of crown if it is a metal crown, pfm crown or zirconia crown what they have to select. According to the crown selected, the biological principles of crown preparation will be done and the measurement will be taken and the lab will fabricate the crown which is custom made according to the particular space availability which will be seated by using a special luting cement. This is how the crowns are prepared for permanent teeth. In case of children teeth, after pulpectomy is done we have custom made crowns called stainless steel crowns which are prefabricated and come in 7 sizes . Depending on the size of the deciduous tooth, the particular size of stainless steel crown will be selected and a slight proximal clearance will be created and the crown will be seated . The deciduous tooth will not require that much of preparation like permanent tooth. So as per the doubt raised hope the concept is understood.
